bill_title: to assure payment of health benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person operating a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol or drugs.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to assure payment of health benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person operating a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol or drugs. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 58-17 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A policy of health insurance for an individual that is delivered, issued for delivery, or renewed in this state may not exclude the payment of benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person because the insured was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, as defined by § 32-23-1, while operating a motor vehicle. Section 2. That chapter 58-18 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A group health insurance policy that is delivered, issued for delivery, or renewed in this state may not exclude the payment of benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person because the insured was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, as defined by § 32-23-1, while operating a motor vehicle. Section 3. That chapter 58-18B be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A health benefit plan of a small employer carrier that is delivered, issued for delivery, or renewed in this state may not exclude the payment of benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person because the insured was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, as defined by § 32-23-1, while operating a motor vehicle. Section 4. That chapter 58-38 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A service or indemnity-type contract issued by a nonprofit medical or surgical service plan corporation that is delivered, issued for delivery, or renewed in this state may not exclude the payment of benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person because the insured was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, as defined by § 32-23-1, while operating a motor vehicle. Section 5. That chapter 58-40 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A service or indemnity-type contract issued by a nonprofit hospital service plan or organization that is delivered, issued for delivery, or renewed in this state may not exclude the payment of benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person because the insured was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, as defined by § 32-23-1, while operating a motor vehicle. Section 6. That chapter 58-41 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A health maintenance contract that is delivered, issued for delivery, or renewed in this state may not exclude the payment of benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person because the insured was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, as defined by § 32-23-1, while operating a motor vehicle.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to assure payment of health benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person operating a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol or drugs. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 58-17 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A policy or certificate of health insurance for an individual that is delivered, issued for delivery, or renewed in this state may not exclude the payment of benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person who is less than twenty-one years of age because the insured was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, as defined by § 32-23-1. Section 2. That chapter 58-18 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A group health insurance policy or certificate that is delivered, issued for delivery, or renewed in this state may not exclude the payment of benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person who is less than twenty-one years of age because the insured was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, as defined by § 32-23-1. Section 3. That chapter 58-18B be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A health benefit plan of a small employer carrier that is delivered, issued for delivery, or renewed in this state may not exclude the payment of benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person who is less than twenty-one years of age because the insured was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, as defined by § 32-23-1. Section 4. That chapter 58-38 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A service or indemnity-type contract issued by a nonprofit medical or surgical service plan corporation that is delivered, issued for delivery, or renewed in this state may not exclude the payment of benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person who is less than twenty-one years of age because the insured was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, as defined by § 32- 23-1. Section 5. That chapter 58-40 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A service or indemnity-type contract issued by a nonprofit hospital service plan or organization that is delivered, issued for delivery, or renewed in this state may not exclude the payment of benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person who is less than twenty-one years of age because the insured was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, as defined by § 32- 23-1. Section 6. That chapter 58-41 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A health maintenance contract that is delivered, issued for delivery, or renewed in this state may not exclude the payment of benefits for injuries sustained by an insured person who is less than twenty-one years of age because the insured was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, as defined by § 32-23-1. Section 7. Nothing in this Act precludes a health insurer, hospital or medical service plan, a health maintenance organization, or any self-funded plan from excluding coverage for an insured for any sickness or injury caused in the commission of a felony. BILL HISTORY 1/29/97 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 220 2/3/97 Deferred to another day. 2/14/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/14/97 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 467

S.J. 532 2/19/97 Senate Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 32, NAYS 1. S.J. 533
